Job Posting Title: Database Administrator 1, 2, or 3 Position Type: Professional / Unclassified Department: LSUAM FA - ITS - DA - PS - Database Administration (Benhou Yan (00007339)) Work Location: 0202 Fred C. Frey Computing Services Building Pay Grade: Professional Job Description: Participate in the administration of the enterprise database management system including change management, security, performance, replication and disaster recovery. The position will also contribute to the ongoing evaluation of database and software development technologies to determine their relevance and suitability to the administrative software development environment at LSU. All Information Technology Services employees are expected to demonstrate a commitment to exemplary customer service in all facets of their work. Job Responsibilities Database Administrator 1: Database Administration: Architect and implement database applications/infrastructures typical of those required to support a large organization and capable of adapting to database structure changes in a dynamic business setting. Perform activities related to administration of LSU enterprise databases and other project-based databases, including capacity planning, logical and physical database design, data integrity and normalization, implementations, configuration and tuning, monitoring and audition, backup and recovery. Maintain database reliability and availability. Develop, implement and enhance database disaster recovery procedures for a large organization. Document processes and procedures related to database administrative activities. Exploit features of new DBMS releases and introduce those features to database and application analysts. (80%) Support: Provide technical support and training to analysts and end users as needed in solving database related problems in a professional manner. Conduct trainings on database and SQL topics. Develop and maintain procedures, scripts, and job schedules to automate or facilitate database operations and maintenance. (10%) Other duties as assigned. (10%) Job Responsibilities Database Administrator 2: Database Administration: Architect and implement database applications/infrastructures typical of those required to support a large organization and capable of adapting to database structure changes in a dynamic business setting. Perform activities related to administration of LSU enterprise databases and other project-based databases, including capacity planning, logical and physical database design, data integrity and normalization, implementations, configuration and tuning, monitoring and audition, backup and recovery. Maintain database reliability and availability. Develop, implement and enhance database disaster recovery procedures for a large organization. Document processes and procedures related to database administrative activities. Exploit features of new DBMS releases and introduce those features to database and application analysts. (70%) Support: Provide technical support and training to analysts and end users as needed in solving database related problems in a professional manner. Conduct trainings on database and SQL topics. Develop and maintain procedures, scripts, and job schedules to automate or facilitate database operations and maintenance. (20%) Other duties as assigned. (10%) Job Responsibilities Database Administrator 3: Database Administration: Architect and implement database applications/infrastructures typical of those required to support a large organization and capable of adapting to database structure changes in a dynamic business setting. Perform activities related to administration of LSU enterprise databases and other project-based databases, including capacity planning, logical and physical database design, data integrity and normalization, implementations, installation/migration, configuration and tuning, monitoring and audition, backup and recovery. Maintain database reliability and availability. Develop, implement and enhance database disaster recovery procedures for a large organization. Document processes and procedures related to database administrative activities. Exploit features of new DBMS releases and introduce those features to database and application analysts. (50%) Support: Provide technical support and training to analysts and end users as needed in solving database related problems in a professional manner. Conduct trainings on database and SQL topics. Develop and maintain procedures, scripts, and job schedules to automate or facilitate database operations and maintenance. (30%) zOS System Adminstration: Research and resolve zOS system problems in collaboration with other Computing Services systems analysts. Provide consultation to and collaboration with operations staff, programmers/analysts, Help Desk personnel, and users in the resolution of software problems and the exploitation of zOS functionality. (10%) Other duties as assigned. (10%) Minimum Qualifications Database Administrator 1: Bachelor's Degree 1 year of experience. Developing and maintaining database structures, both on-premise and on-cloud, in a business setting. Knowledge of policies and issues related to database administration. Experience in developing and maintaining database applications/infrastructures typical of those required to support a large organization. Preferred Qualifications Database Administrator 1: Master's Degree in Computer Science, information systems, engineering, or related degree. 3 years of experience performing all facets of database administration, On-Premise or Cloud. Professional experience in cloud-based databases/online analytical processing (OLAP)/data warehousing, such as Redshift, BigQuery, or Snowflake, is a plus. Familiarity with one or more enterprise level database management systems, such as DB2 for z/OS, DB2 for LUW, Oracle, MySQL, SQL Server or NoSQL. Experience with a variety of operating systems, such as Windows, Linux, z/OS, AIX, or cloud-based platforms, such as AWS or Azure. Minimum Qualifications Database Administrator 2: Bachelor's Degree 2 years of Database administration experience. Developing and maintaining database structures, both on-premise and on-cloud, in a business setting. Knowledge of policies and issues related to database administration. Experience in developing and maintaining database applications/infrastructures typical of those required to support a large organization. Preferred Qualifications Database Administrator 2: Master's Degree in Computer Science, information systems, engineering, or related degree. 3 years of experience performing all facets of database administration, On-Premise or Cloud. Professional experience in cloud-based databases/online analytical processing (OLAP)/data warehousing, such as Redshift, BigQuery, or Snowflake, is a plus. Familiarity with one or more enterprise level database management systems, such as DB2 for z/OS, DB2 for LUW, Oracle, MySQL, SQL Server or NoSQL. Experience with a variety of operating systems, such as Windows, Linux, z/OS, AIX, or cloud-based platforms, such as AWS or Azure. Minimum Qualifications Database Administrator 3: Bachelor's Degree 3-5 years experience. Developing and maintaining database structures, both on-premise and on-cloud, in a business setting. Knowledge of policies and issues related to database administration. Experience in developing and maintaining database applications/infrastructures typical of those required to support a large organization. Preferred Qualifications Database Administrator 3: Master's Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, or related field. 7 years Experience. Professional experience in cloud-based databases/online analytical processing (OLAP)/data warehousing, such as Redshift, BigQuery, or Snowflake, is a plus. Familiarity with one or more enterprise level database management systems, such as DB2 for z/OS, DB2 for LUW, Oracle, MySQL, SQL Server or NoSQL. Experience with a variety of operating systems, such as Windows, Linux, z/OS, AIX, or cloud-based platforms, such as AWS or Azure. + LSU is committed to creating an inclusive space where our employees feel valued for their skills and uniqueness. If you do not meet the minimum qualifications as listed, but have significant experience within the major job responsibilities, we welcome your application. Additional Requirement for Database Administrator 1, 2 and 3: Policy Statement 18 this position is deemed essential to campus operations and will be required to report to or remain on campus during times of emergency or closure. Additional Job Description: Special Instructions: A copy of your transcript(s) may be attached to your application (if available). However, original transcripts are required prior to hire. Please provide three professional references including name, title, phone number and e-mail address. An offer of employment is contingent on a satisfactory pre-employment background check. For questions or concerns regarding the status of your application or salary ranges, please contact Mary Bordelon at mbordelon@lsu.edu. Posting Date: December 13, 2023 Closing Date (Open Until Filled if No Date Specified): Additional Position Information: Background Check - An offer of employment is contingent on a satisfactory pre-employment background check. Benefits - LSU offers outstanding benefits to eligible employees and their dependents including health, life, dental, and vision insurance; flexible spending accounts; retirement options; various leave options; paid holidays; wellness benefits; tuition exemption for qualified positions; training and development opportunities; employee discounts; and more! Remote Work - Positions approved to work remotely outside the State of Louisiana shall be employed through Louisiana State University’s partner, nextSource Workforce Solutions, for Employer of Record Services including but not limited to employment, benefits, payroll, and tax compliance. Positions employed through Employer of Record Services will be offered benefits and retirement as applicable through their provider and will not be eligible for State of Louisiana benefits and retirement. Essential Position (Y/N): Y LSU is an Equal Opportunity Employer and SAME Agency: LSU believes diversity, equity, and inclusion enrich the educational experience of our students, faculty, and staff, and are necessary to prepare all people to thrive personally and professionally in a global society. We celebrate diversity and are committed to the principles of diversity and inclusion. We actively seek and encourage qualified applications from persons with diverse backgrounds, cultures and experiences. To learn more about how LSU is committed to diversity and inclusivity, please see LSU’s Diversity Statement and Roadmap . LSU is also designated as a State As a Model Employer (SAME) agency and provides assistance to persons needing accommodations or with the accessibility of materials. For those seeking such accommodations or assistance related to this search, we encourage you to contact the Office of Human Resource Management ( hr@lsu.edu ). HCM Contact Information: For questions or concerns related to updating your application with attachments (e.g., resumes, RS:17 documents), date of birth, or reactivating applications, please contact the LSU Human Resources Management Office at 225-578-8200 or email HR@lsu.edu . For questions or concerns regarding the status of your application or salary ranges, please contact the department using the information provided in the Special Instructions section of this job posting.

Positions employed through Employer of Record Services will be offered benefits and retirement as applicable through their provider and will not be eligible for State of Louisiana benefits and retirement. Essential Position (Y/N): Y LSU is an Equal Opportunity Employer and SAME Agency: LSU believes diversity, equity, and inclusion enrich the educational experience of our students, faculty, and staff, and are necessary to prepare all people to thrive personally and professionally in a global society. We celebrate diversity and are committed to the principles of diversity and inclusion. We actively seek and encourage qualified applications from persons with diverse backgrounds, cultures and experiences. To learn more about how LSU is committed to diversity and inclusivity, please see LSU’s Diversity Statement and Roadmap . LSU is also designated as a State As a Model Employer (SAME) agency and provides assistance to persons needing accommodations or with the accessibility of materials. For those seeking such accommodations or assistance related to this search, we encourage you to contact the Office of Human Resource Management ( hr@lsu.edu ). HCM Contact Information: For questions or concerns related to updating your application with attachments (e.g., resumes, RS:17 documents), date of birth, or reactivating applications, please contact the LSU Human Resources Management Office at 225-578-8200 or email HR@lsu.edu . For questions or concerns regarding the status of your application or salary ranges, please contact the department using the information provided in the Special Instructions section of this job posting.

description: The Database Administrator maintains the integrity of data including the logical, physical design and implementation of databases. In this role, you'll be responsible for database management including the performance and recoverability of databases, application administration, patching and upgrades. This position will work closely with our Application, Operation and Security teams to build out future application roadmaps. The employee's primary duty must be the performance of office or non-manual work directly related to the management or general business operations of Helena or Helena's customers. This also includes the exercise of discretion and independent judgement with respect to matters of significance. What your day may look like Develop and maintain both application and database tuning and connectivity standards, policies, and procedures, ensuring compliance with industry best practices and security regulations. Follows, defines and manages enterprise level policies and procedures that ensure the security, optimization and integrity of Oracle database environments. Manages database backup & recovery procedures, disaster recovery preparation and the associated exercises. Migrating code, database changes and data through the various stages of development. Database patching and upgrade support. Diagnoses/anticipates and resolves database performance, capacity and replication issues. Participates in client/project meeting(s) for needs assessment and design review. Manages database backup & recovery procedures, disaster recovery preparation and the associated exercises. Collaborates with SAN, server, applications and operational staff in support of database objectives. Manage Concurrent Programs, Request Sets, Request Groups, Workflows, and troubleshoot Workflow Mailer/Notification issues, and take care of user access. Use monitoring tools to proactively monitor systems and respond to various system generated alerts. Administer and maintain Single Sign- On for Oracle Applications. Utilize Applications DBA utilities to support/maintain the multi-node environment to tune and improve database performance. Administer and maintain the Oracle Service Oriented Architecture (SOA), Oracle WebLogic Server to support Oracle EBS system connectivity with integrated systems. Analyze Patches and build execution steps. Perform Oracle EBS Applications database administration (DBA) tasks including patching (adop cycle and opatch), cloning, creating backup/recovery strategies, upgrading, performance tuning. Setup DR environment and supporting periodic DR drills. Perform code and patch migration to non-prod and production environment using the deployed tool or manually by adhering to the set change control policies and procedures. Establish, contribute and adhere to all key departmental operating procedures around governance, project management, software lifecycle management, change management and provide oversight on key delivery of application topology solutions and enhancements as needed. Work closely with Oracle Support and partners. Perform other Oracle EBS DBA related activities. Education and experience needed for this position Bachelor's degree in computer science, IT or related field is required. 5+ years of hands-on experience as an Oracle EBS Applications DBA combined with Oracle Applications system administrator, Oracle WebLogic Administrator and related technologies to maintain, upgrade, and support a multi-node Oracle EBS database 12c/19c and Oracle ERP Application R12.2. Hands-on experience with scripting on Unix and Linux environments using Shell, Perl, SQL, PL/SQL. Knowledge in AIX v7.1/v7.2, Linux, IBM P series hardware, Storage Area Network, Rubrik maintenance is required. Experience in application monitoring using Grid Control and other tools is required. Experience in cloud migration is preferred. Other skills that will help you succeed Strong analytical skills. Familiarity with Oracle EBS technical tools like Oracle Application Framework, BI/XML Reports, Java, JVM, JSP, Oracle Forms/Reports, Interfaces, Workflow etc. Technical and functional knowledge of the Oracle E-Business Suite. Web services (REST or SOAP) Development. Architecture (Cloud, Web Services, SOA). Self-starter and able to deliver results on a proactive and independent basis. Ability to work independently with limited general supervision. Verbal and written communication skills. Interpersonal skills. Works well in a team environment. Partners with both business and technical team members. Your work environment and the physical aspects of the job The work environment for this position is that of a typical office environment where the noise level is mostly quiet. This position requires you to use your hands for many different tasks and to talk, hear, walk, stand and sit. You may be occasionally required to lift or move up to 10 pounds. Who we are Helena Agri-Enterprises, LLC is one of the nation's foremost agronomy solutions providers. We rank near the top nationally in volume and sales for crop production products, fertilizer, custom application, seed and precision agriculture, turf management, industrial weed control, forestry, aquatics and more. As a solutions provider, we help our customers make critical decisions about soil variability, nutrient and water availability, seed selection and pest management. We take pride in working with our growers beyond the sale, helping them in every aspect of their business. Helena operates under several main business groups - Helena Products Group, AGRIntelligence, Helena Industries, LLC and Diversified Applications, Inc. Helena is a special place to be At Helena, we are family. Our employees take care of each other and support each other at work and in their personal life. Our family-like atmosphere creates a positive work environment that allows our employees to be high-performers because they feel comfort and compassion from their leader and team. Our family-like culture is centered on our successful business model -\People...Products...Knowledge.\" \"People\" being the first for good reason. When our employees are treated right and feel cared for
jobName: our customers thrive and our business grows. Helena's commitment to diversity and inclusion At Helena
location: we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive work environment where all our employees feel safe
require: valued and have the opportunity to succeed. We embrace different backgrounds and human experiences because our customers are also diverse. When we all show deep appreciation for each other and our customers it builds trust that strengthens Helena and keeps us competitive. Helena supports individuals with disabilities and reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform job responsibilities. Stay connected to Helena Helena is an equal opportunity employer."

description: Dept Number/Name: 0-3510-000 / Information Technology College Division: Info Tech-Information Tech Salary Plan: Administrative Job Code/Title: 9578 / Database Administrator Hiring Salary/Salary Range: $88,000 - $105,000 Position Number: 00042731 ORGANIZATIONAL SUMMARY: Located in the vibrant and diverse Tampa Bay region of Florida’s gulf coast, the University of South Florida (USF) is a Preeminent State Research University with campuses in Tampa, St. Petersburg and Sarasota-Manatee. Rated as one of the top places to live in the U.S., Tampa Bay offers a high quality of life, year-round sunshine, and easy access to top-rated entertainment. USF is one of the nation’s largest public universities, serving more than 50,000 students with an annual budget of $1.8 billon. Over the past five years, USF has been the fastest-rising university in the nation, public or private, on the U.S. News and World Report's list of best universities, which it ranks as the 44th best public university in America. USF is proud to be an innovating partner within the Tampa Bay region, listed by Forbes as the top emerging tech city in the country. USF Information Technology (USF IT) provides technology services and support for the University of South Florida. The IT team, led by the Vice President and CIO, provides the following services: Administrative Services, Client Support, Communication Services, Teaching and Learning, Analytics and Reporting, Mobile and Web Services, Consulting Services, Cybersecurity Service and Research Technologies. For more information, please visit: Information Technology | University of South Florida (usf.edu) POSITION SUMMARY: The Database Administrator maintains, secures, upgrades, and enhances the databases underlying our core Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) systems including PeopleSoft, Banner, and Degree Works among others. RESPONSIBILITIES: Applies data or structure changes to production databases upon request. Monitors tablespace growth, table fragmentation, corrupt and missing indexes, to reorganize tablespaces, tables and indexes if necessary. Provides research, problem diagnosis, and resolution for database related issues and provides analysis of programs developed by others for performance considerations. Creates databases for development, testing and production. Supports upgrades to enterprise business systems requiring database changes; participates in database-related migrations to cloud-based resources including Microsoft Azure. Establishes database access control to ensure safety and security of the databases. Monitors performance of databases and tunes all instances of the databases if necessary to ensure the overall health of the system. Performs other duties as assigned. POSITION QUALIFICATIONS: MINIMUM: Bachelors degree in Computer Science, MIS or other field involving software and analytical training, and four years of IT related work experience, OR a Bachelor's degree with no specific required field and five years of IT related work experience, OR a Master's degree and three years of IT related work experience, OR a combination of eight years of IT related work experience and validated training. Preparation for a relevant IT certification is considered to be related training. PREFERRED: Sizing cloud database servers for optimal performance within cost constraints to support azure migrations. Participation on a DevOps team, including administrators, engineers, and architects, automating database creation and configuration. Streamlining deployments with database release automation principals and tools Scripting: Bash, PowerShell, etc. Source control: Git, GitHub In-depth knowledge of the Oracle database platform; in-depth skills and abilities in supporting the effective and efficient day-to-day operation of Oracle-based ERP systems.

description: Serve your community. Make a difference. Grow your career. MEANINGFUL WORK awaits you here at the City of North Las Vegas. We serve one of the largest culturally diverse cities in the nation and our community continues to grow! If you value Accountability, Communication, and Teamwork then you are just the person we are looking for! A Database Administrator is an essential member of our team, we invite you to apply and help contribute to CNLV’S growing success! Please thoroughly review the information and selection process outlined below this announcement. ESSENTIAL INFORMATION Submit a Complete Application – For your application to be considered, you MUST fully complete an online application by providing sufficient information to demonstrate how you meet the minimum and any preferred qualifications, attach any documents as necessary, and answer ALL questions. Select “Apply for Job” at the top of this announcement and click “SUBMIT” at the end of your application. Pay Considerations The salary range for the position is $75,372.20 - $121,323.19. Starting salary is dependent on education, qualifications, and experience. The selected candidate for this position will start at the beginning of the salary range, no exceptions. Work Schedule – This position is scheduled to work 4 days per week, 9 hours per day, Monday through Thursday, 8:00am to 6:00pm. THE ROLE Performs database analysis, administration, and development tasks. Responsible for database-oriented project analysis, planning, documentation and coordination. Troubleshoots technical issues and provides excellent and timely customer service. The full job description can be found here: Database Administrator Check out some of our benefits here: CNLV Benefits Flyer MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS Education and Experience Bachelor’s degree from a four-year college or university with major coursework in computer science or information technology. Three years professional experience with at least a 33% focus on database development and administration. Experience must be with Oracle and/or Microsoft SQL Server database platforms. Must be adept at Structured Query Language (SQL) with a proven record developing commands, scripts, stored procedures, and functions. Experience with installing and administering Windows Server and Linux based operating systems. Programming experience in Microsoft.Net, Java, or PHP preferred. Scripting experience with Windows or Linux servers preferred. Education Equivalency: Six years professional experience with at least a 50% focus on database development and administration. Experience must be with Oracle and/or Microsoft SQL Server database platforms. Licenses and Certifications Database certification equivalent or greater than Microsoft Technology Associate (Database) or Oracle Database 12c Administrator Certified Associate. Must possess a valid state driver's license and maintain satisfactory motor vehicle record with the ability to obtain appropriate Nevada state driver’s license within required time frame. SELECTION PROCESS Complete Online Application - Interested candidates MUST submit a completed application through the City’s application system. Evaluation of meeting requirements will be made solely on information provided on the application and any required attachments. The selection process will begin with a screening of the application/resume - The best qualified candidates will be invited to participate in the assessment process. The selection process will include (dates to be determined). Oral Board Interview - (Weighted 100%, Passing Score 70%). Pre-Employment Screening – Selected candidates for this position are subject to a pre-employment screening which includes but is not limited to local & state criminal history check; federal criminal history checks via submission of fingerprints; and drug screening. Selection/Offers - The selection process may include any combination of written, performance, and oral assessments to evaluate job-related education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities. The City reserves the right to modify selection devices and test instruments in accordance with accepted legal, ethical, and professional standards. The City will provide reasonable accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities. It is the responsibility of the candidate requiring accommodation to contact the Human Resources Department (preferably in writing) at the time of application. QUESTIONS? For questions about this position or the selection process, please contact: Matthew Bulavsky | Talent Acquisition Partner Email: bulavskym@cityofnorthlasvegas.com Additional Information People Group: Appointed Compensation Grade: ACE-22 Minimum Salary: 75372.19 Maximum Salary: 121323.19 Pay Basis: YEARLY

description: Department Information Technology Services (ITS) Responsibilities Provides operational support and administration for database technologies. Assists with reviewing, designing and maintaining University databases. Assists management with Oracle Database administration functions. The position is taking on all of the responsibility for Oracle instances, to include ERP. Responsible for day-to-day administration of all tests, development, and production databases including but not limited to, creation and maintenance of data objects, monitoring and performance tuning, installation and software maintenance, and implementation and maintenance of database security. This includes all ERP and Non-ERP Oracle databases. Responsibilities include maintaining the Oracle utilities not limited to creating and updating scripts, installation, and patching of OEM and RMAN, and monitoring of database backups. Responsible for evaluation and recommendation of appropriate technical solutions to resolve database performance issues. Assist management team in the development and implementation of project plans, proposals, and recommended policies and procedures to effectively administer database systems. Responsible for formulation and documentation of procedures to ensure the continued operation of the applications dependent on the databases. Performs duties in compliance with ITS policies, guidelines, and processes pertaining to support requests, work orders, project management, change management, and incident management. Appropriately utilizes associated tools in accordance with ITS standards. Other duties and requirements as specified by the supervisor. Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, MIS, or other appropriate degree and two years' experience or a high school diploma or equivalent and six years of experience. (Note: or a combination of appropriate post high school education and experience equal to six years.) Experience with Oracle 19c including patching, tuning, RAC, Multi-Tenant, Data Guard, OEM Ability to administer database backups using Oracle RMAN Proficient in SQL and PL/SQL including generating scripts Proficient in shell scripting Experience with Golden Gate Knowledge of and ability to interpret and apply related federal, state, and local laws, ordinances, rules and regulations. Knowledge of and ability to interpret and apply related University policies and procedures. Knowledge of standard concepts, practices, and procedures within the network and data field. Knowledge of standard programming languages, concepts, practices, and procedures within the technology field. Knowledge of PeopleSoft development and interfacing methodology. Preferred Qualifications Knowledge of Automic Knowledge of Cohesity Experience with other databases i.e. SQL Server, MySQL, Snowflake University Information One of the nation's elite research universities, Florida State University preserves, expands, and disseminates knowledge in the sciences, technology, arts, humanities, and professions, while embracing a philosophy of learning strongly rooted in the traditions of the liberal arts and critical thinking. Founded in 1851, Florida State University is the oldest continuous site of higher education in Florida. FSU is a community steeped in tradition that fosters research, encourages creativity, and embraces diversity. At FSU, there’s the excitement of being part of a vibrant academic and professional community, surrounded by people whose ideas are shaping tomorrow’s news! Learn more about our university and campuses. FSU Total Rewards FSU offers a robust Total Rewards package. Visit our website to learn more about our Compensation, Benefits, Wellness, Recognition, and Employee Development programs. Use our interactive tool to calculate Total Compensation options based on potential salary, benefits and retirement contributions, earned leave, and other employment-related perks. How To Apply If qualified and interested in a specific job opening as advertised, apply to Florida State University at https://jobs.fsu.edu. If you are a current FSU employee, apply via myFSU > Self Service. Applicants are required to complete the online application with all applicable information. Applications must include all work history up to ten years, and education details even if attaching a resume. Considerations This is an A&P position. This position requires successful completion of a criminal history background check. This posting is open until filled. Applications will be reviewed as they are received. Equal Employment Opportunity An Equal Opportunity/Access/Affirmative Action/Pro Disabled & Veteran Employer. FSU's Equal Opportunity Statement can be accessed at: https://hr.fsu.edu/sites/g/files/upcbnu2186/files/PDF/Publications/diversity/EEO_Statement.pdf.

Knowledge of standard programming languages, concepts, practices, and procedures within the technology field. Knowledge of PeopleSoft development and interfacing methodology. Preferred Qualifications Knowledge of Automic Knowledge of Cohesity Experience with other databases i.e. SQL Server, MySQL, Snowflake University Information One of the nation's elite research universities, Florida State University preserves, expands, and disseminates knowledge in the sciences, technology, arts, humanities, and professions, while embracing a philosophy of learning strongly rooted in the traditions of the liberal arts and critical thinking. Founded in 1851, Florida State University is the oldest continuous site of higher education in Florida. FSU is a community steeped in tradition that fosters research, encourages creativity, and embraces diversity. At FSU, there’s the excitement of being part of a vibrant academic and professional community, surrounded by people whose ideas are shaping tomorrow’s news! Learn more about our university and campuses. FSU Total Rewards FSU offers a robust Total Rewards package. Visit our website to learn more about our Compensation, Benefits, Wellness, Recognition, and Employee Development programs. Use our interactive tool to calculate Total Compensation options based on potential salary, benefits and retirement contributions, earned leave, and other employment-related perks. How To Apply If qualified and interested in a specific job opening as advertised, apply to Florida State University at https://jobs.fsu.edu. If you are a current FSU employee, apply via myFSU > Self Service. Applicants are required to complete the online application with all applicable information. Applications must include all work history up to ten years, and education details even if attaching a resume. Considerations This is an A&P position. This position requires successful completion of a criminal history background check. This posting is open until filled. Applications will be reviewed as they are received. Equal Employment Opportunity An Equal Opportunity/Access/Affirmative Action/Pro Disabled & Veteran Employer. FSU's Equal Opportunity Statement can be accessed at: https://hr.fsu.edu/sites/g/files/upcbnu2186/files/PDF/Publications/diversity/EEO_Statement.pdf.

description: Data Intelligence Technologies, a subsidiary of Axiologic Solutions is looking for a Database Administrator (MySQL & Oracle) to join our team. Our team members are exceptional people who care deeply about their work, their clients, and their mission by listening and delivering. Come help us to make an impact on our client’s toughest mission challenges. *Commitment to employees *Meaningful work *Career advancement *Collaborative spirit *Work-life balance *Diverse workforce *Veteran proud We have a generous compensation package to include but is not limited to, competitive medical/dental/401(k) plans, an electronic stipend, and an opportunity for profit sharing! Description: 8 + years experience administering to, and engineering solutions with MySQL and Oracle’s database (10 – 12). Extensive experience with database design and modeling; as well as, the collection and interpretation of customer requirements relevant to database migration, troubleshooting, performance observation and tuning. Installing and configuring new MySQL servers (5.x and 8.x) Upgrading MySQL databases, both major and minor revisions Administering MySQL account access, backups and table spaces Migrating MySQL databases Monitoring MySQL server performance Significant experience with the production and deployment of RAC, RMAN backup & recovery desired Experience with Streams / GoldenGate, DB security, DB Guard and / or DB Vault, Oracle Enterprise Manager Cloud Control, label security, and data migration desired Occasional after hours call-in required on an as needed basis. BS in CS or related course of study, or equivalent year’s experience. Must be an independent worker with strong communications skills. Must be COMPTIA / IAT 2 Certified Qualifications: Active TS/SCI with polygraph Minimum General Experience: At least ten (10) years developing and delivering IT Architectures or IT systems design/ engineering services or supported that activity with an organization. Functional Responsibility: Provides architecture and business consulting services. Functions as lead consultant and project manager on technically complex projects. Minimum Education: A BS in Computer Science, or related discipline, or equivalent years of experience. As a federal contractor Axiologic Solutions and its employees must comply with customer worksite requirements, which requires that federal contract employees to be vaccinated against COVID-19 or be required to test weekly. As part of accepting this offer you must show proof of vaccination against COVID-19 or agree to test weekly for Covid-19. Applicants with a physical or mental disability, who require a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process, may e-mail their request to Jennifer.chavira@axiologicsolutions.com or call 571-758-3780. Determinations on request for reasonable accommodation will be made on a case-by-case basis. Equal Opportunity Employer–minorities/females/veterans/individuals with disabilities/sexual orientation/gender identity.

description: DLA Piper is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. Job applicant poster viewing center. DLA Piper is, at its core, bold, exceptional collaborative and supportive. Our people are the backbone, heart and soul of our firm. Wherever you are in your professional journey, DLA Piper is a place you can engage in meaningful work and grow your career. Let’s see what we can achieve. Together. If you are a highly talented Sr Database Administrator, we want to hear from you! This position is remote. Candidates may be required on occasion to visit the local office when/if needed. Minimum Requirements: High School or GED 6 years’ experience in Information Technology 2 years’ experience in a lead or supervisory position Must have excellent SQL and database administration skills Good technical skills to provide interpretation and communication/negotiation between technical resources Ability to effectively present and communicate information to technical staff, all levels of end users, vendors, and management Strong organizational and project planning skills to manage a variety of complex projects and assignments Preferred Requirements: Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field 10 years’ experience in Information Technology What will your day look like? As a Sr Database Administrator, you will design, deploy, and manage highly available and scalable database architectures with a focus on Microsoft SQL Server and Azure SQL. You will monitor and optimize database performance, identifying and resolving performance bottlenecks and other issues to ensure optimal system performance. You will develop and implement database backup and disaster recovery strategies to ensure data integrity and minimize downtime. In this role, you will perform database capacity planning and resource utilization analysis to ensure adequate scalability and efficient resource allocation. You will collaborate with development teams to provide guidance and support in optimizing database queries, data models, and application integration. You will troubleshoot and resolve database-related incidents and issues including storage, performance, availability, data integrity, and database security. Furthermore, you will implement and enforce security and access control measures to protect sensitive data. You will proactively identify potential issues, risks, and areas for improvement in the database infrastructure and propose and implement solutions. You will stay up-to-date with the latest database technologies, tools, and best practices, and recommend their adoption when appropriate. You will perform and automate database management, maintenance, and data processing activities. Additionally, you will create and implement monitoring and alerting solutions to detect and prevent issues before they impact our users and applications. You will participate in on-call rotation to ensure 24/7 availability of our systems and services. You will lead and mentor developers and other data team members. You will continuously identify and implement process improvements to increase efficiency and reduce risk. You will document processes related to database design, configuration, standards, and performance. You will also design, develop, implement, and maintain data pipelines and ETL processes. To learn more about DLA Piper, please visit our website. We offer exceptional career opportunities in an environment that is challenging, rewarding, and, we believe, truly different from our competitors. Our employees enjoy a competitive benefits package and a dynamic and diverse environment in which they can build a long and fruitful career and reap the rewards of their success. Physical Demands, Work Environment, and Other Requirements Sedentary work: Exerting up to 10 pounds of force occasionally and/or a negligible amount of force frequently or constantly to lift, carry, push, pull or otherwise move objects, including the human body. Sedentary work involves sitting most of the time. Jobs are sedentary if walking and standing are required only occasionally, and all other sedentary criteria are met. Application Process: If you have a request for an accommodation during the application process or have any questions about the process, please contact careers@us.dlapiper.com. Please add noreply@dlapipercareers.us to your list of safe senders. Applicants must apply directly online instead of sending application materials via email. Agency applications will not be considered.

description: Title: SQL Server DBA , Remote role Only GC/Citizen/EAD candidate rate $60-$65 w2 Must Haves: 1) Overall 10 years and 7 years in MS SQL Server operational dba experiences 2) Hands-on experience and solid knowledge with MS SQL Server HA including Always on available group option 3) Database performance trouble shooting & turning/resolution A Microsoft SQL Server DBA Consultant shall possess 7+ years technical knowledge and experience with the following systems, platforms, applications skills: Experience administrating Microsoft Windows Server – versions 2008 R2 / 2016 / 2019 Experience building Microsoft Windows Clusters using Microsoft Windows Server – versions 2008 R2 / 2016/ 2019 Experience with Microsoft SQL Server databases, capacity planning, performance tuning, high availability in complex environments and mission critical applications. Experience with T-SQL, PowerShell, VB.Net, VB Script, and Windows Script Expert with Microsoft SQL Server, Microsoft SQL Server Reporting Services(SSRS), Microsoft SQL Server Integration Services(SSIS), Microsoft SQL Server Analytical Services(SSAS) - versions 2008 R2 / 2016 / 2019 Experience building/deploying SSIS packages Experience building/deploying SSRS reports Experience providing SSAS support Experience building/deploying SQL Jobs, including database maintenance packages In-depth experience with installation, configuration, upgrade, patching, migrating the above Microsoft SQL Server products to higher versions or/and different hardware or/and different OS, including SQL Server in a clustered environment. Expert in disaster recovery Expert Microsoft SQL Server DBA hands on skills in supporting a production database in all operations, such as troubleshooting daily operational issues Expert in being able to troubleshoot various issues within Microsoft Windows Server or/and Microsoft SQL Server Providing end user support and customer service management. Extensive knowledge with complex SQL and T-SQL programming and optimization. Good writing skills to provide documentation for DBA and other teams.

description: Eaton’s Information Technology division is currently seeking an Oracle Database Administrator to join our team. This position can be based at our Beachwood, Ohio, Moon TWP, PA, Raleigh, NC, Houston, TX, Menomonee Falls and Galesburg, MI facility. The position is eligible for a hybrid work setup. The expected annual salary range for this role is $88,499 - $129,799 a year. Please note the salary information shown above is a general guideline only. Salaries are based upon candidate skills, experience, and qualifications, as well as market and business considerations. What you’ll do: Database Administrators are responsible for ensuring that databases and underlying infrastructure and systems are operating smoothly and that applications are working as expected. They monitor databases, applications and associated services to reduce downtime and ensure availability and system performance. Administrators utilize automation to improve reliability, reduce manual effort, and reduce errors. Database Administrators will work closely with customers, developers and testers as part of project activities. They provide guidance and recommendations for database specifications according to application and customer requirements. They install and configure new databases according to Eaton standards. They are required to address all critical issues with top priority, and work on non-critical issues with appropriate priority to meet service-level agreements. Job Responsibilities Install, support, enhance, and maintain database and application environments using a combination of processes and tools Analyze server requirements, provide solution design Help developers, vendors, and testers create and support database solutions to meet their requirements. Implement configuration management, security policies, maintain software standards Develop, and Implement enhancements that will improve the performance and reliability of the database environment Works with Cybersecurity engineers to ensure standard practices, testing, and security principles are being adopted and enforced within database environments Work closely with development teams and vendors to understand application purpose and setup to assess optimal options for database installations, usage, and ensure proper deployment of databases related to their applications. Create and maintain technical documentation, including requirement translation, technical specifications, and support documents. Provide training to less experienced database administrators and support teams Collaborate with other technical groups Qualifications: Required (Basic) Qualifications: Bachelors degree from an accredited institution Minimum of 3 years of database administration experience Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without company sponsorship now or in the future. This position requires use of information or access to hardware which is subject to the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR). All applicants must be U.S. persons within the meaning of ITAR. ITAR defines a U.S. person as a U.S. Citizen, U.S. Permanent Resident (i.e. 'Green Card Holder'), Political Asylee, or Refugee. No relocation benefit is being offered for this position. Only candidates within a 50-mile radius of the work locations listed will be considered. Active-duty military Service member candidates are exempt from the geographical area limitation. Preferred Qualifications: Experienced in understanding of Oracle database architecture, administration, patching, backups, installation, configuration, and security. Experience and ability to read, modify and create SQL, PL/SQL, database triggers, stored procedures, replication jobs. Experience with SQL tuning and database tuning Experience managing databases in LINUX environments Experience with automation concepts, automatic provisioning of software and infrastructure, logging, and visualization of statistics Experience with Oracle EBS R12.2 administration, including patching, upgrades, cloning, and system administration Experience working with Agile methodologies Skills: Position Criteria: Effective verbal and written communication skills including the ability to explain technical concepts Working knowledge of Linux environment and tools Ability to read, modify and create Linux bash scripts. Ability to use RMAN for backup and restore. Solid understanding of concepts such as latency, performance, availability, efficiency, change management, and monitoring Strong problem solving and software debugging skills Ability to embrace change and continuously learn Good judgment, time management, and decision-making skills Ability to work collaboratively on a technical team Understanding of how to have difficult conversations with developers at times Experience working with diverse, global cultures, organizations and teams We are committed to ensuring equal employment opportunities for all job applicants and employees. Employment decisions are based upon job-related reasons regardless of an applicant's race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, marital status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other status protected by law. Eaton considers qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with local laws. To request a disability-related reasonable accommodation to assist you in your job search, application or interview process, please call us at 1-800-836-6345 to discuss your specific need. Only accommodation requests will be accepted by this phone number. We know that good benefit programs are important to employees and their families. Eaton provides various Health and Welfare benefits as well as Retirement benefits, and several programs that provide for paid and unpaid time away from work. Click here for more detail: Eaton Benefits Overview. Please note that specific programs and options available to an employee may depend on eligibility factors such as geographic location, date of hire, and the applicability of collective bargaining agreements.

description: CoverMyMeds, part of McKesson Corporation, is a fast-growing healthcare technology company recognized as a “Best Place to Work” by Glassdoor and a “Best Company to Work For” by FORTUNE. Through innovation and collaboration, CoverMyMeds’ solutions help people get the medicine they need to live healthier lives by seamlessly connecting the healthcare network to improve medication access, thereby increasing speed to therapy and reducing prescription abandonment. CoverMyMeds’ network includes 75 percent of electronic health record systems (EHRs), 50,000+ pharmacies, 750,000 providers, and most health plans and PBMs. We are in search of a Database Administrator to join our team and help create solutions to increase the efficiency of our healthcare system. These systems help millions of patients receive their prescription medications every year. This role is responsible for creating highly available databases and planning for scale as we continue to grow. As a Database Administrator (DBA), you would be responsible for Database Management and Maintenance, Data Modeling and Design, Backup and Recovery, Performance Tuning, Security, Troubleshooting, Capacity Planning, Documentation, and Compliance and Standards Role Responsibilities Oversee the installation, configuration, and maintenance of our databases Ensure the database performance, availability, and security Partner with development teams to design and implement database structures and to optimize database usage in an application Implement and regularly test backup and recovery plans to ensure data integrity Monitor and optimize database performance using tuning techniques Implement robust security measures to protect data against unauthorized access or breaches Diagnose and resolve database related issues Forecast future database needs and plan for necessary hardware/software upgrades Maintain detailed documentation of database architectures, configurations, and procedures Ensure databases practices comply with legal regulations and industry standards Required Skills and Qualifications 3 + years professional experience working with relational databases in a Database Administration, Database Developer, or Database Engineer capacity; preferably with PostgreSQL 3+ years of experience managing highly available environments Professional experience with data replication in a clustered environment Proven experience monitoring for potential issues and proactively recommending solutions Experience partnering closely with development teams Self-starter with a problem solver mentality Desired skills and Technical Experience SQL, PostgreSQL GitHub Ansible Microservices architecture experience within Azure is a huge plus System level experience with Windows or Linux Ability to analyze complex systems with specific attention to detail Excellent written and verbal communication skills Effective collaborator and the willingness to be flexible Team player mentality with specific focus on inclusion Excellent verbal and written communication skills At CoverMyMeds, we care about the well-being of the patients and communities we serve, and that starts with caring for our people. That’s why we have a Total Rewards package that includes comprehensive benefits to support physical, mental, and financial well-being. Our Total Rewards offerings serve the different needs of our diverse employee population and ensure they are the healthiest versions of themselves. For more information regarding benefits at CoverMyMeds, please click here. As part of Total Rewards, we are proud to offer a competitive compensation package at CoverMyMeds. This is determined by several factors, including performance, experience and skills, equity, regular job market evaluations, and geographical markets. In addition to base pay, other compensation, such as an annual bonus or long-term incentive opportunities may be offered. Our Base Pay Range for this position $99,400 - $165,600 CoverMyMeds is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We embrace diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to race, religion, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability or veteran status.

preferably with PostgreSQL 3+ years of experience managing highly available environments Professional experience with data replication in a clustered environment Proven experience monitoring for potential issues and proactively recommending solutions Experience partnering closely with development teams Self-starter with a problem solver mentality Desired skills and Technical Experience SQL, PostgreSQL GitHub Ansible Microservices architecture experience within Azure is a huge plus System level experience with Windows or Linux Ability to analyze complex systems with specific attention to detail Excellent written and verbal communication skills Effective collaborator and the willingness to be flexible Team player mentality with specific focus on inclusion Excellent verbal and written communication skills At CoverMyMeds, we care about the well-being of the patients and communities we serve, and that starts with caring for our people. That’s why we have a Total Rewards package that includes comprehensive benefits to support physical, mental, and financial well-being. Our Total Rewards offerings serve the different needs of our diverse employee population and ensure they are the healthiest versions of themselves. For more information regarding benefits at CoverMyMeds, please click here. As part of Total Rewards, we are proud to offer a competitive compensation package at CoverMyMeds. This is determined by several factors, including performance, experience and skills, equity, regular job market evaluations, and geographical markets. In addition to base pay, other compensation, such as an annual bonus or long-term incentive opportunities may be offered. Our Base Pay Range for this position $99,400 - $165,600 CoverMyMeds is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We embrace diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to race, religion, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability or veteran status.

jobName: Microsoft Dataverse Administrator / Database Administrator for Brightworks 365 application

description: OVERVIEW: The Database Developer/Admin plays a pivotal role in AGR's application team, supporting both daily operations and development initiatives. You'll collaborate with diverse teams (web devs, network team, business analysts) to ensure AGR's ERP system (NetSuite) and auxiliary systems run smoothly and efficiently. RESPONSIBILITIES: Bridge the gap between business needs and technical solutions: Extracting and documenting requirements,understanding what the business needs and translating it into actionable technical specifications. Data engineering - designing and implementing data models, APIs, andcreating the backbone of efficient and effective data storage, lineage, and retrieval. Developing and integrating secure, scalable applicationsthat align with industry best practices. Administering SQL Servers and Oracle Servers,ensuring optimal performance and security. Performing unit and system testing,guaranteeing applications and components function flawlessly. Monitoring data feedsbetween internal systems and external partners. Providing application and integration supportto business system owners. You're a technical chameleon, comfortable in multiple environments: N-Tier Architecture,designing modular and adaptable applications. Microsoft Products and Oracle Database,fluent in both platforms. Azure, SQL Server, NetSuite development,crafting code across varied environments. XML Schema expertise,defining and manipulating data structures. REQUIREMENTS: 3+ years of experience:in relational databases (SQL Server preferred) Computer science degree or equivalent experience. Solid knowledge of data modeling, databases, security standards, BI tools, ETL tools and Microsoft Azure specific technologies Teamwork and independent work:seamlessly transitioning between collaboration and solo execution. Problem-solving and time management:juggling diverse tasks and projects efficiently. Continuous learning:a thirst for knowledge and improvement,keeping pace with AGR's evolving needs. Positive and cooperative communicationwith colleagues,clients,and management. Willingness for occasional overtime and weekend work, including scheduled pager coverage.

description: Analytica is seeking a remote Database Administrator to support an enterprise-wide data environment for a high-profile federal client. As part of our team, you will work with a diverse group of sophisticated professionals to provide database administration and maintain applications and architectures. Analytica has been recognized by Inc. Magazine as one of the fastest-growing 250 businesses in the US for 3 years. We work with U.S. government clients in health, civilian, and national security missions to build better technology products that impact our day-to-day lives. The company offers competitive compensation with opportunities for bonuses, employer-paid health care, training and development funds, and 401k match. Responsibilities include (but not limited to): Perform troubleshooting on any database issues, performance analysis, ensuring database security, evaluating new database trends and technologies, developing and testing shell scripts, scripting and coding required for database administration and associated database tools Work as part of a team to design and develop code, scripts, and data pipelines that leverage structured and unstructured data integrated from multiple sources Design and develop automated test cases that verify solution feasibility and interoperability, to include performance assessments Tune the SQL Server and IBM DB2 databases for optimal performance in large scale / big data environment Manage the database's storage structures; managing users and security Basic Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology, or other scientific or quantitative fields. 3+ years of experience as a Database Administrator Experience administering, operating, maintaining, and securing a SQL Server and/or IBM DB2 database environment Experienced in database tuning to improve process efficiency Experience monitoring and administering security including credential management, auditing access, and checking for security problems. Ability to obtain and maintain security clearance Knowledge of data/database technologies for Analytics and Warehousing are a plus Ability to obtain and maintain security clearance About Analytica: Analytica is a leading consulting and information technology solutions provider to public sector organizations supporting health, civilian, and national security missions. The company is an award-winning SBA certified 8(a) small business that has been recognized by Inc. Magazine each of the past three years as one of the 250 fastest-growing companies in the U.S. Analytica specializes in providing software and systems engineering, information management, analytics & visualization, agile project management, and management consulting services. The company is appraised by the Software Engineering Institute (SEI) at CMMI® Maturity Level 3 and is an ISO 9001:2008 certified provider. As a federal contractor, Analytica is required to verify that all employees are fully vaccinated against COVID-19. If you receive an offer and are unable to get vaccinated for religious or medical reasons, you may request a reasonable accommodation. G1ntDyDmot

description: Required Qualifications (must be documented on resume): BA/BS plus at least four years of work experience in the areas of database design and administration, or a master's degree plus at least two years of experience. Experience with Oracle 12 and/or later editions, including Oracle installation and configuration, patching, security, Oracle Data Guard, Oracle Gateways, Oracle Multi-tenant and Recovery Manager (RMAN). Experience with database-related Linux administration and running databases on Linux. Experience with Oracle Enterprise Manager Cloud Control including setup, jobs and advanced monitoring. Experienced with SQL, PL/SQL, Shell Scripting. Experience with RMAN backup and restore in 12c and 19c single and multitenant database architecture. Experience with patching and upgrading Oracle Databases to 19c. Experience in capacity planning and performance tuning. Ability to write and maintain large PL/SQL packages. Preferred Qualifications: HTML and PHP with Oracle PostgreSQL or MS SQL Server PowerShell Scripting Position Overview: At the University of Minnesota, University Services, our vision is to provide exceptional and welcoming campuses that are safe and reliable for all who learn, live, work, and visit. Apply today to join our IT team as a Database and System Administrator, where you'll be at the forefront of shaping our enterprise services through effective database infrastructure. As a key player in our cross-functional teams, you'll enjoy the autonomy to craft and evolve diverse environments and architectures with a mix of responsibilities including maintaining systems, embracing new technologies, and managing multiple projects with precision and skill. Our opportunity will allow you to flex both your technical muscles and interpersonal savvy as you bridge the gap between deep technical details and user-friendly communication. We value learning, innovation, and professional growth and are here to support you in your next endeavor. Job Responsibilities: Serve as the unit expert on database administration for the University Services business unit. Participate in on-call rotation, which involves carrying a communication device. This involves responding to critical system issues during non-business hours to resolve production problems. Architect, deploy, and support highly-available database solutions, including the design, documentation, and automation of database administration tasks that meet the service needs of the business and the University. Proactive maintenance including monitoring space, ensuring performance for availability, and forecasting storage and resource requirements for the database systems. Provide resolution to incidents and problems, including the creation of post-mortem documentation detailing root cause and process modification in response to service outages and failures. Align to change management processes and standards and follow those procedures when making any changes. Interact with service owners and customers to ensure functional service requirements are met with proper technical resources. Optimize and monitor performance metrics using standard tools, autonomously responding to trends as appropriate to maintain or exceed expected performance. Develop and support vendor inbound and outbound integration interfaces. Maintain functional Oracle accounts, database links and Oracle gateways. Perform scheduled maintenance activities including planned work outside of business hours. Refresh user acceptance testing (UAT), development, and other environments when necessary. Understand and follow procedures identified by CIS and other security standards, as well as maintaining database security and audit compliance. Keep current on industry standards, emerging technologies such as cloud database options and business frameworks. ***Please note, this position is not eligible for H-1B or Green Card sponsorship. Work Environment: This is a hybrid position sharing time between on-site and remote work. On-site expectations are approximately twice per week, but can vary depending on business needs. Applications must be submitted online. To be considered for this position, please click the Apply button and follow the instructions. You will be given the opportunity to complete an online application for the position and attach a cover letter and resume. Additional documents may be attached after application by accessing your \My Job Applications\" page and uploading documents in the \"My Cover Letters and Attachments\" section. To request an accommodation during the application process

description: Overview: Our team members are the heart of what makes us better. At Hackensack Meridian Health we help our patients live better, healthier lives — and we help one another to succeed. With a culture rooted in connection and collaboration, our employees are team members. Here, competitive benefits are just the beginning. It’s also about how we support one another and how we show up for our community. Together, we keep getting better - advancing our mission to transform healthcare and serve as a leader of positive change. The Database Administrator III provides database administration for Epic Clarity, Cogito, and Caboodle databases including administration, replication, backup/restore procedures, query assessment, performance tuning, troubleshooting and related DBA activities. They will work closely with the Data and Analytics and BI teams to ensure platform availability and stability. This third level position is usually assigned larger more complex jobs than the level I or II jobs, but smaller or less complex systems or business units than are assigned to the higher level Database Administrators. This is a hybrid position, there is a mix of onsite and remote work with a flexible schedule, once a month, typically a Wednesday, and as needed for events. C andidates must have Epic experience and certifications in Epic Clarity/ Cogito ETL Caboodle Administration. Epic Iris experience is preferred. They should also have experience in either SQL Server or Oracle. Responsibilities: A day in the life of a Database Administrator III at Hackensack Meridian Health includes: Take ownership of problems through to resolution over a wide variety of systems and technologies. Ensure internal database systems are managed to the highest standard by following industry best practice. Performs work under minimal supervision. Handles complex issues and problems. Demonstrate problem management ownership and prevention of downtime. Actively contribute to the development of existing and new IT process and procedures to enhance service transition and service operation lifecycle stages. Demonstrate self-starter capabilities identifying areas of improvement and taking action in order to address service impacting issues. Provide operational support for the Epic Cache/ Oracle/ Windows/SQL Server database environment. Database backup/restores, daily checks, maintenance tasks and building new database instances and applying service packs. Manage and escalate problems as appropriate and Investigate defects or problems, work with infrastructure and external vendors to identify solutions and support any fixes that are required as part of service improvement. Follow the Change Management procedure and other standard practices in installing, configuring and supporting databases and related items in Test and Production environments. Ensure service uptime is prioritized and all faults, incidents and problems are responded to in an efficient manner without negatively impacting SLAs and reporting metrics in place. Upgrade or maintain software at a time when the impact to the business is minimized. Other duties and/or projects as assigned. Adheres to HMH's Organizational competencies and standards of behavior. Qualifications: Education, Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Required: Bachelors level degree or equivalent in Information Technology/Math/Computer Science or related field. A minimum of four years of experience. Analytical skills, communication skills, adaptable, and flexible. Windows Server Operating Systems Security concepts and technologies, including PCI & PHI understanding . Active Directory, Group Policy, DBS, DHCP & DFS. Enterprise storage, Enterprise-scale patch management & related maintenance methodologies. Network principles, protocols & Technologies. Epic Cache, Cogito, Oracle, SQL and other database technology platforms, backup & recovery, including, Disaster Recovery. Education, Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Preferred: Six years of experience. Prior healthcare experience

description: Job Description: Acquisition) environment. Comprehensive understanding of industry standards related to database administration. Key Responsibilities: Database Management and Maintenance: Ensure data integrity, availability, and optimized performance. Conduct regular health checks to determine the status of databases, identifying fragmentation, outdated indexes, and potential performance-impacting issues. Implement, manage, and test backup and recovery solutions, including full, differential, and log backups. Oversee off-site and cloud-based backup strategies to ensure data redundancy and protection against geographical threats. Performance Optimization: Continuously monitor and analyze database performance metrics. Optimize SQL queries, adjusting and adding indexes as necessary. Manage and allocate database resources to ensure smooth performance. Security and Compliance: Regularly update and patch database software to address vulnerabilities. Implement and manage access controls, ensuring data encryption both at rest and in transit. Execute regular audits to ensure data security and regulatory compliance. Scalability and Availability: Design and maintain databases with future scalability considerations. Implement clustering and replication strategies for high availability and load balancing. Database Administration in a SCADA Environment: Monitor SCADA systems to ensure data integrity and availability. Design and implement database architectures that support SCADA system needs and complexities. Prioritize system security and ensure that databases are resistant to potential SCADA-specific vulnerabilities. Additional Duties related to Senior Database Administrator: Develop and implement database policies and procedures. Liaise with IT teams, developers, and management to ensure database solutions meet organizational needs. Offer technical support and troubleshooting for database-related issues. Mentor junior database administrators and staff on best practices and procedures. At SPN Solutions Inc., our success is deeply rooted in the expertise and dedication of our esteemed professionals. We are actively seeking a Senior Database Administrator—a candidate who not only aligns with our values but also brings a wealth of knowledge combined with a forward-thinking perspective. If you are passionate about driving transformation, pioneering innovation, and making a significant impact in the domain, we invite you to join our team.
